name: sharex
title: ShareX
description: Raycast extension for Windows that allows you to capture your screen using ShareX.
author: roschreiber

preferences.name: sharexPath
preferences.title: ShareX's Executable Path
preferences.description: This should be the path to your ShareX.exe file.

preferences.name: useRaycastForms
preferences.label: Use Raycast's instead of ShareX's File Picker?
preferences.description: Enable this if you want to use Raycast's forms as a file picker instead of the ShareX GUI.

preferences.name: useContentViewer
preferences.label: Use Content Viewer?
preferences.description: The Content Viewer is basically a preview that appears whenever you upload something from your Clipboard. Check this to enable it.

preferences.name: screenColorPicker
preferences.label: Use Color Picker GUI?
preferences.description: ShareX has either a 'quick' color picker or a GUI. Check this to enable the GUI.

commands.name: captureRegion
commands.title: Capture Region
commands.description: Capture a selected region of your screen.

commands.name: captureActiveWindow
commands.title: Capture Active Window
commands.description: Capture the currently active window. Running this from Raycast will minimize Raycast first.

commands.name: uploadClipboard
commands.title: Upload Clipboard
commands.description: Uploads the content of your clipboard to your selected image host in ShareX.

commands.name: metadata
commands.title: View Metadata
commands.description: Views the metadata of a file.

commands.name: imageEditor
commands.title: Open image editor
commands.description: Opens ShareX's built in image editor.

commands.name: openScreenshotsFolder
commands.title: Open Screenshots Folder
commands.description: Opens the Screenshots folder defined in ShareX.

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
